writeHandlerID - Variable in class org.vertx.java.core.net.NetSocket
When a NetSocket is created it automatically registers an event handler with the event bus, the ID of that handler is given by writeHandlerID.

writeQueueFull() - Method in class org.vertx.java.core.http.HttpClientRequest
If the amount of data that is currently queued is greater than the write queue max size see HttpClientRequest.setWriteQueueMaxSize(int) then the request queue is considered full.
writeQueueFull() - Method in class org.vertx.java.core.http.HttpServerResponse
If the amount of data that is currently queued is greater than the write queue max size see HttpServerResponse.setWriteQueueMaxSize(int) then the response queue is considered full.
writeQueueFull() - Method in class org.vertx.java.core.http.WebSocket
If the amount of data that is currently queued is greater than the write queue max size see WebSocket.setWriteQueueMaxSize(int) then the write queue is considered full.
writeQueueFull() - Method in interface org.vertx.java.core.streams.WriteStream
This will return true if there are more bytes in the write queue than the value set using WriteStream.setWriteQueueMaxSize(int)
